document.docTitle: Notogaster charlesi Fernandez-Triana & Ward 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Notogaster, a new genus of Microgastrinae (Hymenoptera: Braconidae) from New Zealand

Diagnostic description. Mesosoma mostly to extensively light (orange, yellow or light yellow-brown); metasoma dorsally mostly light (orange, yellow or light yellow-brown); gena with relatively large and clear pale spot; tegula pale; first two pairs of legs entirely pale (yellow, orange or light yellow-brown), rarely with coxae darker; metacoxa pale; metafemur mostly pale (yellow, orange or light yellow-brown); metatibia mostly yellow; T 2 mostly sculptured. See Table 1 for additional morphological measurements.
Notogaster charlesi
is one of the most distinctive in the genus because of its light colouration and large pale spot on the gena ( Figs 12 and 13 ). Only
N. macdonaldae
has a relatively similar light body colouration (although some areas of mesosoma and metasoma are slightly darker), but the main difference is that
N. macdonaldae
lacks a pale spot on the gena.

Molecular data. The species has two DNA barcode compliant sequences in BOLD (plus 14 additional partial barcode sequences), corresponding to BIN BOLD :ACL8814, which is 1.36% different to the closest BIN in BOLD . We have only been able to examine one of those 16 barcoded specimens (with voucher code WAM 0344) which has one partial sequence (407 bp).
Distribution. AK, BP, HB, KA, MZ, ND, NN, WD, WI ( Fig. 2 ).
Etymology. Named after John Charles for his contribution to entomology in New Zealand .
